intro: Buchnera strictissima, commonly known as the slender buckler-fern, is a member of the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves that are arranged in a compact, rosette-like structure. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or brownish in color. Buchnera strictissima is native to parts of South America, particularly in regions with moist, shaded environments. It is often found growing in rocky or forested areas, where it thrives in humid, cool conditions.
